A user reports that they do not have the option to create new teams in the Microsoft Teams app.
You need to ensure that the user can create teams.
What should you do?

discussion.content:

questions.question_text:
Contoso, Ltd. uses the domain contoso.com. The company adds fabrikam.com as an additional domain.
You schedule a meeting from the contoso.com domain by using the Microsoft Teams app. You are unable to add a user named UserA@fabrikam.com to the meeting.
You need to resolve this issue.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Ensure that the Fabrikam.com domain is verified in Microsoft 365.
choices.E: Set the value of the HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled attribute to True for the user's mailbox.
choices.C: Assign a Microsoft Exchange license to UserA.
choices.A: Assign an audio conferencing license to UserA.
choices.D: Set the value of the HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled attribute to False for the user's mailbox.

questions.question_text:
You manage the Microsoft Teams environment for a ExamTopics company.
The company has federation configured only for the human resources (HR) department, and only with VendorA. User1, who is part of the HR department, cannot communicate with VendorA.
You need to troubleshoot why User1 cannot communicate with VendorA.
What should you do?

UserA works at CompanyA and UserB works at CompanyB. CompanyA configures Microsoft Teams to use Islands mode. CompanyB configures Teams to use
TeamsOnly mode. UserA sends a Teams message to UserB.
UserB receives the message. The following notification displays:
//IMG//

UserB selects the Continue your conversation here link. The following message displays in the new chat window:
//IMG//

You need to provide a solution so that the two users can successfully communicate with each other.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: If UserB coexistency is set to Teams Only, how can he use Skype for business to chat with userA

discussion.content:
i would say: A and B

When recipients are in Islands: chats and calls initiated from Teams land in S4B if recipient is federated https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-and-skypeforbusiness-coexistence-and-interoperability

I´d say A and C

A - Interop should work between Island and Teams mode
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-and-skypeforbusiness-coexistence-and-interoperability#federation

C - Is does not say the user should add the federation. But adding federation in Tenant is required. Assume that its only configured onprem.

wrong:
B - as user cannot change the mode (only admin)
D - there is no change on User B side - so why to sign out?
E - Not possible, as user is in Teams Only Mode

Correct answer for me is B&C. Had a the same problem in my organisation and we changed individual user coexistence mode to TeamsOnly (set to Islands mode previously). As the other answers dont sound right. In this scenario, it may be the organisation is allowing/blocking domains.

A is incorrect - After upgrading to Teams Only mode, all messages and calls from outside your organization are delivered to Teams
D is incorrect - Signing in/out will not resolve the issue as the 2 organisations are in different coexistence modes
E is incorrect - The process of upgrading to Teams only mode is irreversible. There's no direct way to revert TeamsOnly to Islands mode

I think the answer is A and B. 
Note: Federation is already enabled as User B is able to receive User A messages. Hence we don't need to add any domains in any company. (As mentioned by IgorMatic in discussion)
B : Obviously as moving user to Teams mode will enable Teams to Teams external chat
A : In Islands mode all external chats and calls are received on Skype. Hence it is recommended users in Islands mode use SFB for all communications with External users/numbers.

In other words, Island modes gives users 2 endpoint (teams/SFB) wherein SFB client is preferred for external comms.
